intro: Cantua buxifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf woollyhead, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive silvery appearance. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique appearance and hardiness.
